summary: Hunter Pitts O'Dell, also known as Jack O'Dell, is mentioned in the context of testimonies before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) regarding investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. The documents focus on the testimony of retired FBI Special Agent Alan G. Sentinella. The documents suggest that the SSC was investigating potential communist influence within the SCLC and the role of individuals like Stanley Levison. O'Dell's connection arises within the scope of these investigations, implying scrutiny of his potential involvement or association with communist elements and his relationship with King and the SCLC.
